data.title: Segment King
data.solution:
distance = float(input())
best=second=0
names=[]

for i in range(int(input())):
    inputs = input().split()
    name = inputs[0]
    speed = float(inputs[1])
    if speed>best:
        second = best
        best = speed
        names = [name]
    elif speed==best:
        names += [name]
    elif speed > second:
        second = speed

print(' '.join(names),f'{distance/(second/3600)-distance/(best/3600):.2f}')
data.statement:
It's a popular trend to record runs and bike rides and compete with others. 
Given a GPS segment and a list of people who have completed it, print out the winner and the time they are leading by.

data.constraints:
0.0 < [[distance]] <= 40.0
0 < [[n]] <= 750
0 < length([[name]]) < 15
no [[name]]s have a space
There is always at least 1 person who isn't 1st
Output seconds rounded to 2 decimal places
data.stubGenerator:
read distance:float
read n:int
loop n read name:word(20) speed:float
write Jon 10.89
data.inputDescription:
<<First Line: >> Segment length [[distance]] in km
<<Second Line: >> Number of competitors [[n]]
<<Next [[n]] Lines: >> Space separated [[name]] and [[speed]] in km/h
data.outputDescription:
[[name]] of the winner and time in seconds (rounded to hundredths) they are winning by separated by a space (seconds between first and second place)
ex. "Jacob 125.45"
If there is a tie, print all names (in the order they competed) and the time won by 
ex. "Jacob Steve Frank 33.50"

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

It's a popular trend to record runs and bike rides and compete with others.
Given a GPS segment and a list of people who have completed it, print out the winner and the time they are leading by.
Input
First Line: Segment length distance in km
Second Line: Number of competitors n
Next n Lines: Space separated name and speed in km/h
Output
name of the winner and time in seconds (rounded to hundredths) they are winning by separated by a space (seconds between first and second place)
ex. "Jacob 125.45"
If there is a tie, print all names (in the order they competed) and the time won by
ex. "Jacob Steve Frank 33.50"
Constraints
0.0 < distance <= 40.0
0 < n <= 750
0 < length(name) < 15
no names have a space
There is always at least 1 person who isn't 1st
Output seconds rounded to 2 decimal places
Example
Input
0.3
10
Howard 47.31
Hugo 31.24
Mildred 47.61
Junior 23.97
Brenda 43.75
Kay 49.54
Marie 28.45
Noah 22.31
Gregory 48.79
Melvin 25.32
Output
Kay 0.34
